definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
"fire" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 86), occurring in 熙, 然, 熊 etc
important point/main point/focus/key (project etc)/to focus on/to put the emphasis on
to recount (e.g. results of election)/to re-evaluate
important point/main point/focus/key (project etc)/to focus on/to put the emphasis on
to recount (e.g. results of election)/to re-evaluate
test point/to carry out trial/pilot scheme

sentences.english: The remote search server is a single point of failure.
sentences.chinese: 远程搜索服务器是一个单点故障点。

sentences.english: But sooner or later we will return to our emotional set-point.
sentences.chinese: 但是迟早我们会返回到我们的情感点。

sentences.english: When the markets opened the following Monday, the Dow bid adieu to 10000 for good.
sentences.chinese: 股市在紧接着的周一开盘时就告别了10000点。

sentences.english: Which soup do you want? We have Eggdrop Soup with Sliced Tomatoes, Famous Hot &Sour Soup.
sentences.chinese: 您来点什么汤？我们有番茄蛋花汤，酸辣汤。

sentences.english: His diving expeditions, which often involved extensive hours at sea, covered some 30 sites in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 他长时间在海中考察，潜水点更多达三十多处。

sentences.english: Next door, Chueh-min struck a match and lit the oil lamp.
sentences.chinese: 在隔壁房间里觉民把火柴擦燃，点了灯。

sentences.english: So when I woke up early this morning at 8am it was actually only 7am.
sentences.chinese: 所以，当我早上8点醒来时，实际上才7点钟。

sentences.english: I have a coupon for five dollars off a steak dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我有一张点牛排可以少五元的折价券。

sentences.english: Research will need to be done for each power point video presentation.
sentences.chinese: 研究将需要为每个电源点的视频演示完成。
孩子们，安静点!咱们开始吧。

sentences.english: Having data sets with a non-white space character separating the data points is a very common occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的就是数据集合不使用空格字符分隔数据点。

sentences.english: He has a better eye for similarities among cultures than for diversities.
sentences.chinese: 他看各种文化之间的相似点比看其相异点更为透彻。

sentences.english: He has a better eye for similarities among cultures than for diversities.
sentences.chinese: 他看各种文化之间的相似点比看其相异点更为透彻。

sentences.english: Afterwards, we go back in for another lesson until lunch at 12:00.
sentences.chinese: 之后，我们回教室上另一节课，至到12点吃午饭。

sentences.english: He turned the heat up because it was very cold inside the house.
sentences.chinese: 他把暖气开大了点，因为屋里非常冷。

definition: Diandian (Chinese microblogging and social networking website)
classifier indicating a small amount or small number greater than 1: some, a few, several
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
(of a child etc) small as a mite/minuscule
